lessons.title: 1. Types of Malware
lessons.description: Learn about different types of malware in detail, discover their characteristics and how they work

pages.title: What is Malware?
pages.content:
Malware is software designed to harm computer systems, networks, and users, gain unauthorized access, or steal data.

Basic Features:
• Operates covertly to avoid detection
• Replicates and spreads itself
• Damages systems and data
• Provides remote access
• Encrypts, corrupts, or steals data

Currently, millions of new malware variants are created daily, making them one of the most effective weapons for cybercriminals.

pages.title: Virus
pages.content:
Viruses are malicious software that can copy themselves and infect other programs or documents, spreading like biological viruses.

Features:
• Self-replication and spreading
• Infection of programs/files
• System damage
• Often hidden by file extensions

Types:
• File viruses (.exe, .com)
• Boot sector viruses (infects during computer startup)
• Macro viruses (infects Word/Excel documents)
• Multipartite viruses (multiple entry points)

Protection:
• Using antivirus software
• Installing updates
• Avoiding opening suspicious email attachments

pages.title: Worm
pages.content:
Worms are malicious software that spreads across networks without user intervention, typically consuming system resources or causing severe damage.

Features:
• Self-replication and spreading
• Consumption of network resources
• Spreading via email and messages
• Rapid infection

Famous Examples:
• Morris Worm (1988) - Infected 60,000 computers
• MyDoom (2004) - Sent 1.9 billion emails
• Conficker (2008) - Affected 15 million computers
• WannaCry (2017) - Hit 200,000 systems in 150 countries

Protection:
• Security software
• Network segmentation
• Up-to-date patches

pages.title: Trojan Horse and Ransomware
pages.content:
Trojan Horse is software that appears useful but performs malicious tasks in the background. Ransomware is a special type of Trojan Horse that encrypts user files and demands a ransom.

Trojan Horse Features:
• Appearing as useful
• Stealing data by working secretly
• Providing remote access
• Installing other malware

Types:
• Remote access
• Encryption
• Banking
• Keylogger
• Privacy violation

Ransomware Features:
• Encrypting files
• Demanding ransom
• Selling decryption keys
• Threatening the user

Protection:
• Antivirus software
• Regular backups
• Using up-to-date software

pages.title: Quiz: Computer Security
pages.question: Which type of malware spreads itself by copying itself over a network?
pages.explanation: Worms spread over a network without user intervention and infect systems.

lessons.title: 2. SQL Injection Attacks
lessons.description: Learn about SQL injection attacks and how to prevent them

pages.title: What is SQL Injection?
pages.content: SQL Injection is a code injection technique used to attack data-driven applications. It involves inserting malicious SQL statements into an entry field for execution.

pages.title: Types of SQL Injection
pages.content: There are several types of SQL injection attacks including Union-based, Boolean-based blind, Time-based blind, and Error-based SQL injection. Each type has different characteristics and detection methods.

pages.title: SQL Injection Prevention
pages.content: Preventing SQL injection involves using parameterized queries, input validation, stored procedures, and proper error handling. These techniques help protect applications from SQL injection attacks.

pages.title: Testing for SQL Injection
pages.content: Testing for SQL injection vulnerabilities involves using automated tools, manual testing techniques, and code review. It's important to test all input fields and parameters.

pages.title: Quiz: SQL Injection
pages.question: What is the most effective way to prevent SQL injection?
pages.explanation: Parameterized queries are the most effective way to prevent SQL injection as they separate SQL code from data.
